segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 5. Rohitassavagga
segments.en: 5. With Rohitassa

segments.pli: 41. Samādhibhāvanāsutta
segments.en: 41. Ways of Developing Immersion Further

segments.pli: “Catasso imā, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four ways of developing immersion further.

segments.pli: Katamā catasso?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya saṃvattati;
segments.en: There is a way of developing immersion further that leads to blissful meditation in the present life.

segments.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā ñāṇadassanappaṭilābhāya saṃvattati;
segments.en: There is a way of developing immersion further that leads to gaining knowledge and vision.

segments.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satisampajaññāya saṃvattati;
segments.en: There is a way of developing immersion further that leads to mindfulness and awareness.

segments.pli: atthi, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: There is a way of developing immersion further that leads to the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya saṃvattati?
segments.en: And what is the way of developing immersion further that leads to blissful meditation in the present life?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi … pe … catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption … second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the way of developing immersion further that leads to blissful meditation in the present life.

segments.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā ñāṇadassanappaṭilābhāya saṃvattati?
segments.en: And what is the way of developing immersion further that leads to gaining knowledge and vision?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ālokasaññaṃ manasi karoti, divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhāti—
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant focuses on the perception of light, concentrating on the perception of day,

segments.pli: yathā divā tathā rattiṃ, yathā rattiṃ tathā divā.
segments.en: regardless of whether it’s night or day.

segments.pli: Iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā ñāṇadassanappaṭilābhāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the way of developing immersion further that leads to gaining knowledge and vision.

segments.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satisampajaññāya saṃvattati?
segments.en: And what is the way of developing immersion further that leads to mindfulness and awareness?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

segments.pli: viditā saññā … pe … viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṃ gacchanti.
segments.en: They know perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away. They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satisampajaññāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the way of developing immersion further that leads to mindfulness and awareness.

segments.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattati?
segments.en: And what is the way of developing immersion further that leads to the ending of defilements?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbayānupassī viharati:
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates observing rise and fall in the five grasping aggregates.

segments.pli: ‘iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo;
segments.en: ‘Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the ending of form.

segments.pli: iti vedanā, iti vedanāya samudayo, iti vedanāya atthaṅgamo;
segments.en: Such is feeling, such is the origin of feeling, such is the ending of feeling.

segments.pli: iti saññā, iti saññāya samudayo, iti saññāya atthaṅgamo;
segments.en: Such is perception, such is the origin of perception, such is the ending of perception.

segments.pli: iti saṅkhārā, iti saṅkhārānaṃ samudayo, iti saṅkhārānaṃ atthaṅgamo;
segments.en: Such are choices, such is the origin of choices, such is the ending of choices.

segments.pli: iti viññāṇaṃ, iti viññāṇassa samudayo, iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo’ti.
segments.en: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.’

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the way of developing immersion further that leads to the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Imā kho, bhikkhave, catasso samādhibhāvanā.
segments.en: These are the four ways of developing immersion further.

segments.pli: Idañca pana metaṃ, bhikkhave, sandhāya bhāsitaṃ pārāyane puṇṇakapañhe:
segments.en: And it was in this connection that I said in ‘The Way to the Beyond’, in ‘The Questions of Puṇṇaka’:

segments.pli: ‘Saṅkhāya lokasmiṃ paroparāni,
segments.en: ‘Having surveyed the world high and low,

segments.pli: Yassiñjitaṃ natthi kuhiñci loke;
segments.en: they’re not shaken by anything in the world.

segments.pli: Santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso,
segments.en: Peaceful, unclouded, untroubled, with no need for hope,

segments.pli: Atāri so jātijaranti brūmī’”ti.
segments.en: they’ve crossed over birth and old age, I declare.’”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these four ways of developing immersion…

suttaplex.blurb: Developing convergence for pleasure, understanding, mindfulness, and ending defilements.
